unnormalised: Hey guys, I'm kinda worried about my grandmother. She's been having these weird episodes lately. I'm no Dr., but I think it might be something neurological. She forgets things easily, like where she kept her specs or if she took her meds. Sometimes she repeats herself, like telling the same story 3-4 times in an hour!
normalised: Hey guys, I'm kind of worried about my grandmother. She's been having these weird episodes lately. I'm no D-R, but I think it might be something neurological. She forgets things easily, like where she kept her specs or if she took her meds. Sometimes she repeats herself, like telling the same story three or four times in an hour!

unnormalised: The other day, she was supposed to prepone her appointment with Dr. Rao at Lilavati Hospital, but she completely forgot about it! Then she got really confused trying to pay the auto-rickshaw driver Rs. 50. It took her like, 10 mins just to count the money.
normalised: The other day, she was supposed to prepone her appointment with D-R Rao at Lilavati Hospital, but she completely forgot about it! Then she got really confused trying to pay the auto-rickshaw driver rupees fifty. It took her like, ten minutes just to count the money.

unnormalised: My mom says it's just old age, but I read online that it could be early signs of Alzheimer's or something like that. The article I read mentioned things like memory loss, difficulty with planning, and changes in mood. It said to consult a neurologist ASAP if you notice these symptoms.
normalised: My mom says it's just old age, but I read online that it could be early signs of Alzheimer's or something like that. The article I read mentioned things like memory loss, difficulty with planning, and changes in mood. It said to consult a neurologist A-S-A-P if you notice these symptoms.

unnormalised: Has anyone else experienced this with their family members? Any advice on what to do next? Should we get a second opinion from someone at AIIMS, Delhi? Maybe book an MRI to be sure? I'm really stressed and just want her to be okay. Any info would be really helpful.
normalised: Has anyone else experienced this with their family members? Any advice on what to do next? Should we get a second opinion from someone at A-I-I-M-S, Delhi? Maybe book an M-R-I to be sure? I'm really stressed and just want her to be okay. Any info would be really helpful.

unnormalised: Thanks in advance! I'm just worried about her and want to make sure she gets the best care possible. Planning on taking her to a neurologist on 15/07/2024 if we can get an appointment, fingers crossed.
normalised: Thanks in advance! I'm just worried about her and want to make sure she gets the best care possible. Planning on taking her to a neurologist on fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four if we can get an appointment, fingers crossed.
